data.name: Find  heroes
data.description:
, \ / , / \ )\__/( / \ / \ (_\ /_) / \ __________________/_____\__\@ @/___/_____\_________________ | |\../| | | \VV/ | | | | FIND LOST HEROES | | GAME OF THRONES | | | |__________________________________________________________| | /\ / \\ \ /\ | | / V )) V \ | |/ ` // ' \| ` V '

You have to extract all character names from a novel passage.

All names at this kata are made of a first name followed by a family name.

Attention

A first name is a word that begins with a capital letter, followed by the family name. A family name is a word that begins with a capital letter, preceded by a first name. Between the first name and the family name can be nickname surrounded by quote marks.

Task

In the first place, you have to implement the function getFirstNames to extract all first names in a text as a set of strings. In the second place, you have to implement the function getFamilyNames to extract all last names in a text as a set of strings. Thirdly, you have to implement the function getFullNames to extract all full names ("first_name last_name") in a text as a set of strings. For this, you must ignore nicknames surrounded by quote marks between first and last names (e.g. Edward "Blackbeard" Teach). In all functions, elements in the collection must be unique.

Example snippet

"Jon Stark se promenait avec Arya Stark et Claude "Evil" Baratheon. En croisant Jean Targaryen et Christine Frey, ils s'enquirent de l'Ã©tat de Bernard Martell, en convalescence chez Francis "Francis" Tyrell. Arya Stark et Christine Frey repartirent vers Port-Royal tandis que Jean Targaryen resta discuter avec Jon "Sait-Rien" Stark."

Examples

See all examples in "Example Tests"
